name: reformative
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
involving or intended to cause reform (= improvement, especially of a person's behaviour or the structure of something): Release from prison on parole is a part of the reformative process. They claim the proposal will have a reformative effect. We believe that the criminal justice system should focus on being reformative rather than punitive.
More examplesFewer examplesThe reformative commitment appeared to be strongly supported by both management and employees.Given the conditions, maintaining any sense of prison being reformative was almost impossible. They found some examples of reformative programmes that were effective with certain groups of offenders.
